snippet: William Dalrymple writes about the Salman Rushdie controversy.
abstract: William Dalrymple writes about the Salman Rushdie controversy.
lead_paragraph: In the years that followed the publication of Salman Rushdie's novel, "The Satanic Verses," a tragic game of Chinese whispers took place among those Indian Muslims who decided to take action against the novel. Few of them had ever read it: the book was banned in India before more than a handful of copies had arrived at customs, so of the many of pages that were written about the book in Rushdie's home country, almost all were based on hearsay.

headline.main: Myth and Fiction at the Jaipur Literature Festival
